archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Galician-Style Tuna & Pepper Empanada Slab with Arugula-Tomato Salad
description: A showstopping Spanish slab pie with a slow-cooked tuna-pepper sofrito wrapped in olive-oil dough, baked golden and sliced for sharing. Served with a bright arugula-tomato salad.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F with a rack in the middle.
Proof dough liquids: warm 1 1/4 cups water until just warm to the touch.
Measure dry dough base: 4 cups flour, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp sugar, and 2 tsp yeast.
Dice 2 onions, finely chop 4 cloves garlic.
Open and drain 3 cans worth of tuna (approx. 450–500 g total).
Roughly chop 1/2 cup olives and 2 tbsp parsley.
For salad: halve 2 cups tomatoes and thinly slice 1/4 red onion; set aside with 4 cups arugula.
Line a large baking sheet (about 30×40 cm) with baking paper and lightly oil it.
cook_steps: Make dough: In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, sugar, and yeast. Add 1/4 cup olive oil and the warm water. Mix, then knead 8–10 minutes until smooth. Lightly oil the bowl, cover, and let rise until doubled (45–60 minutes).
Cook sofrito: Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a wide pan over medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until translucent.
Add red pepper and cook 6–8 minutes until soft.

Stir in garlic; cook 1 minute. Add 2 tbsp tomato paste, 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and a pinch of salt. Simmer 8–10 minutes until thick and jammy.
Fold in drained tuna, olives, and parsley. Cook 2 minutes to combine, then cool the filling to lukewarm.
Divide risen dough into two pieces (one slightly larger). Roll the larger piece to fit the baking sheet with a slight overhang; transfer to the sheet.
Spread the cooled filling evenly over the base, leaving a 2 cm border.
Roll the second dough piece to cover. Lay over the filling, trim excess, then fold and crimp edges to seal. Cut 4–5 small steam slits. Brush top lightly with olive oil.
Bake 30–40 minutes until deep golden and crisp. Rest 10 minutes before slicing.
Make salad while baking: In a bowl, combine arugula, tomatoes, and red onion. Dress with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp vinegar, a squeeze of lemon, salt, and black pepper; toss.
Slice the empanada slab into squares and serve with the salad.

Core and dice 2 red pepper.

Cook sofrito: Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a wide pan over medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until translucent.

Stir in garlic; cook 1 minute. Add 2 tbsp tomato paste, 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and a pinch of salt. Simmer 8–10 minutes until thick and jammy.
Fold in drained tuna, olives, and parsley. Cook 2 minutes to combine, then cool the filling to lukewarm.
Divide risen dough into two pieces (one slightly larger). Roll the larger piece to fit the baking sheet with a slight overhang; transfer to the sheet.
Spread the cooled filling evenly over the base, leaving a 2 cm border.
Roll the second dough piece to cover. Lay over the filling, trim excess, then fold and crimp edges to seal. Cut 4–5 small steam slits. Brush top lightly with olive oil.

ingredients.preparation: divided for dough, filling, brushing, salad

final_ingredients.preparation: divided for dough, filling, brushing, salad
